question: How many cats do you have and what are their names?
answer:
We have two girls, Juliet and Olivia! They also have middle names (Elsa & Jane) — yes, they are fancy LOL. Juliet is my mini-me, you can almost always find her on my lap. She loves to sleep next to me too, but only if she gets covered with a blanket & gets to lay her head next to mine on my (our) pillow. She loves her laser toy, especially when its on the setting that looks like a butterfly. She also LOVES food (and snacks), and would eat once an hour if I allowed it.



Olivia is a little explorer. If we go on vacation, she'll walk around immediately into every room very bravely like she owns the place. She loves looking at everything. If there's a door that's closed (like a closet or something), she's going to ask you to open it because she NEEDS to know what's inside. She also likes her private time & asks us to go in the garage where she likes to get her "me" time & hang out on her beanbag. She's very friendly & warms up to everyone right away. Both girls are very sweet. They're also very peaceful & gentle — so much so I've seen them both catch bugs a few times, and instead of hurting the bug — they gently "pet" the bug, leaving it unharmed.

question: Do you have any other pets?
answer: No — these two are a handful. Especially Juliet. She likes to (try) to eat human food, crumb, paper, cardboard, plastic, blankets, etc. She enjoys tearing up carpet/chewing on cords (we had to get cord protectors for everything). Needless to say she keeps us busy.

question: Are you a licensed veterinarian giving medical advice?
answer: No, I am not a licensed veterinarian & the information provided on this blog is not intended as medical advice. I share general tips and personal experiences to help cat parents. For any health concerns or specific medical advice about your cat baby, it’s always best to consult with a licensed veterinarian who can provide expert guidance tailored to your pet’s needs.

question: Can I give you feedback about an article?
answer: I’d love to hear your feedback! Feel free to share your thoughts—I’m always open to hearing how I can improve or what you enjoyed! You can contact me through our contact page.

question: Can you write a review about _?
answer: If I start getting a bunch of questions about a specific toy, litter, cat tree, or whatever else has caught your eye, I’ll do my best to track it down and give it a thorough review. So, if there’s something you’re curious about, don’t be shy—just ask! You can reach out to me through our contact page.

question: I work for X brand. Can you review our product?
answer:
Maybe! You’re welcome to ask, but whether or not I accept a product review depends on a couple of factors:

• How much I personally like the product—if it’s something I wouldn’t use myself, I’m likely to decline.
• How beneficial I think it’ll be for my cats—if I think my kitties will love it, I’m much more likely to say yes!

If you’re interested in sending me a product, contact me through our contact page.
